headline: Money and Me
description: A poetic reflection on the tension between financial comfort and spiritual longing, framed through biblical symbolism and personal confession.

fieldDefinitions.timeFelt: During a period of financial questioning and spiritual inventory, post-reflection on material blessings
fieldDefinitions.resonantThread: The battle between abundance and asceticism
fieldDefinitions.whyItMatters: Articulates a common but rarely confessed inner conflict: how to live meaningfully without idolizing or rejecting wealth

motifMap.meaning: The spiritual barrier wealth may create between the self and salvation
The small-scale hoarder, guarding treasure regardless of size
Spiritual readiness for a life stripped of possessions

fieldDefinitions.articleExcerpt: Money makes people forget their hearts. It isn’t the root of evil to me, but it can be the water and the fertilizer.

associatedMedia.description: Black and white illustration of a camel passing through the eye of a needle, symbolic of the post's core biblical metaphor
